conclusion: Determine the kinetic energy of the electron at point C.
The electron exits the electric field at point C with a velocity that forms a 30° angle with the initial velocity v0.
The horizontal component of the velocity remains unchanged, so v_x = v_0 = 4 × 10^6 m/s.
The vertical component of the velocity is v_y = v_x * tan(30°) = (4 × 10^6) * sqrt(3)/3 = 4 sqrt(3) × 10^6/3 m/s.
The total velocity v_t is calculated using the Pythagorean theorem: v_t = sqrt(v_x^2 + v_y^2) = sqrt(16 × 10^12 + 48 × 10^12/9) = sqrt(21.33 × 10^12) ≈ 4.62 × 10^6 m/s.
Mass of the electron m = 9.1 × 10^-31 kg.
The kinetic energy KE of the electron is given by KE = 1/2 m v_t^2.
The kinetic energy of the electron at point C is approximately 1.6 × 10^-17 J.
